N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.16 - Car rental-off airport

State Regulations
(a) General
system. All off-airport car rental operators under access permit with the NFTA
shall have the nonexclusive privilege of using loading/unloading areas which
are designated for use by the general driving public for their courtesy
vehicles. Such a vehicle may load/unload at the airport only passengers whose
transportation by such vehicle arises from a car rental transaction. The
off-airport car rental operators may cause a direct line telephone service to
be installed between its business establishment, and the airport and pay the
appropriate charges, it may indicate the location of said telephone service in
the terminal buildings by an appropriate sign or signs. (b) Rules applicable to off-airport car
rental courtesy vehicles. (1)

Vehicle
appearance and running condition. All courtesy vehicles shall be kept clean and
in first class running condition. (2)

Cruising. Cruising on airport property is
prohibited. (3)

Unauthorized
parking. Drivers of courtesy and rental vehicles shall not park in areas other
than public parking areas. (4)

Solicitation. Off-airport car rental operators, or any driver or employee of
such operators, shall not engage in solicitation at the airport or in any way
collaborate with or encourage any other person to solicit business at the
airport on such operator's behalf. (5)

Delivery/return rental cars. An
off-airport car rental operator shall not deliver actual rental cars to the
airport or allow customers to return these vehicles to the airport, but shall
only utilize courtesy vehicles for the pick-up and drop-off of
customers. (6)

Improper conduct. Courtesy vehicle operators, drivers, and employees shall not engage in improper
conduct, including, but not limited to, boisterous conversations, profanity or
fighting at the airport, nor shall they provide misleading information
concerning their own or any other ground transportation service at the airport, or any other service at the airport. (7)

Vehicle requirements. Each vehicle shall
at all times meet all requirements imposed by the New York State Departments of

Transportation and Motor Vehicles, in addition to all other applicable State, city and other local ordinances. (8)

Nonconcessionaire commercial vehicle
identification. Each courtesy vehicle shall be identified by the name of the
business that owns or operates it and must display a decal. (c) Fees and charges. As set forth
in the airport tariff as approved by the NFTA Board of

Commissioners. Notes
